result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Cheryl D Johnson was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber release for treatment or older care if meets jail criteria.
to be installed immediately, time will not begin until defendant obtains valid license.

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
for Half-Priced IID

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 3:43pm
State appears by ADA Sidney Brubacher.  Deft appears with Atty John Bliss

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
State moves to:
Ct. 2 Operating w/PAC (2nd) >> dismissed outright
COURT grants above
PLEA: 
Ct. 1 OWI (2nd) >> GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: Pay $1,429 fine inclusive of all costs (includes DNA surcharge). CONDITIONS: Serve 5 days MCJ, may be with huber release for treatment or elder care if meets jail criteria. Deft has 45 days to report to jail. 12 months DL revocation, administrative credit for any time already served. 12 months IID to be installed immediately, time will not begin until deft obtain's valid license. Legal limit 0.02. 6 points against driving record. Complete AODA assessment with follow through; deft does not need to duplicate AODA if already completed. Provide DNA sample. Zero days credit. 

Adj: 4:00pm
Plea hearing on August 1, 2016 at 03:45 pm.

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 2:04pm
State appears by ADA Ralph Uttke for ADA Sidney Brubacher.  Defendant appears in person with Atty John Bliss
Date and time was set for plea hearing

State says agreement was to show proof of deft getting AODA treatment before proceeding with plea today which was for 2 point drop
Atty Bliss states deft completed AODA a few months ago at NCHC and is completing individual counseling there now
Atty Bliss states deft does not have proof of attending AODA at NCHC
COURT states there are letters in court file from ATTIC Correctional Services stating deft missed 3 appointments and would not be eligible for SSTOP program due to non-appearances
COURT also would like proof of attending AODA before proceeding with plea today
COURT will reset matter for plea and sentencing in 2 weeks for deft to provide proof of AODA compliance

Dates: future plea date to be set with Br. 1 JA
